docs.lead_paragraph: 2016 could be the year of the sugar tax, as several large nations consider levies on sweetened food and drinks to battle obesity and fatten government coffers.

headline.main: For Sugar Tax Supporters, 2016 May Be the Sweet Spot
headline.print_headline: For Sugar Tax Supporters, 2016 May Be the Sweet Spot

docs.lead_paragraph: As she walks along a dirt road in central Malawi, Louise Abale carries her precious maize wrapped in a brightly coloured cloth and balanced on her head.

headline.main: In Southern Africa, an Illusion Built on Aid Heralds Hope and Hunger
headline.print_headline: In Southern Africa, an Illusion Built on Aid Heralds Hope and Hunger

docs.lead_paragraph: The pantries have sprung up across the country to help people who view their pets as family, and spend their last dollars on a can of Purina.

headline.main: Pet Food Pantries Offer Relief to Animal Owners Struggling With Bills
headline.print_headline: No Longer Picking Whether They Eat Or Their Pets Do

docs.abstract: Pet food pantry opened by Animal Care Centers of NYC in Bronx has given out over 2,000 pounds of pet food to low-income owners in first five months of operation; pantry is part of national push by animal welfare organizations to reduce population in animal shelters by assisting poor pet owners before they resort to giving up their animals; critics have questioned whether it is appropriate use of resources.
docs.snippet: The pantries have sprung up across the country to help people who view their pets as family, and spend their last dollars on a can of Purina.
